## Urban resource management: opportunities

## Challenges/Research questions

### Challenges dealt with here

- Define optimal metabolism, among different resource types
- Introduce optimisation modelling to UM
- Formulate a tractable problem which can represent an urban system
- Data needs
- Transparency: on the basis that modelling is about "insight" rather than numbers (Hamming).
- Transparency/Open source: to assist with both the introduction of UM optimisation, and the data needs

### Challenges not dealt with here

- socioeconomic/political/agent-based (transfer to the real-world)
- system operation

## Methods and thesis structure

Note the methodological challenge of the literature review(s), and how we meet that challenge through online search tools combined with bash and R programming.
	- to gather data
	- to locate our work within its related fields

By the end of the literature review, we will be suitably placed to precisely define each term in our title, but for now, it roughly approximates to "some computational means to exploit synergies to meet demand for goods and services in cities".
